column4: Why does apt-get rubygems say it is uptoday whena gem -v clearly shows an out of date version. Most gems need a newer version.
because it's up-to-date as of the ubuntu repositories
what is on your system is the newest in the repos. that's all apt-get can tell you
is there something wrong with it that ubuntu repositories are not being updated?
new versions of upstream software go into new versions of ubuntu. only bugs are fixed in stable ubuntu releases
I'll try that thanks
you could perhaps request a backport of the newer version for an older ubuntu release. there's a separate repository just for that
can up upgrade my ubuntu?
err can I upgrade my ubuntu release. I'm currently at 10.04
system -> admin -> software sources -> updates. set it to allow normal upgrades (instead of just long term support (LTS) releases), then open up update manager
thank you. How do you do that command line I'm running server
ah ok. just a second
/etc/update-manager/release-upgrades    <-- modify that file to "normal" instead of "lts"
then "sudo apt-get update && sudo do-release-upgrade"
thank you!!!!!
I'm sorry to bother again. it said no new release found
after changing it to normal and then doing apt-get update?
Sorry how do I change it to normal?
sudo vi ...that file i said...
big comment explains what different values for the variable mean, then at the end the variable is set to "lts" ...you need to change it to "normal"
that fixed it
thank you for dealing with my idiouscy
it's not idiocy, just inexperience. everybody has to ask for help first time through doing something new!
I'll be sure to pay that forward. thx again
